WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
As of 0.8.2, when attempting to access unexported of modules or private members of classes the following error message is given: 

"The property 'Bar' does not exist on value of type 'Foo'".

This error message is technically incorrect. The member *does* exist, it just is not accessible. I think the error message should be fixed to report that it does in fact exist, it is just not accessible. 

I occasionally make this mistake, so a more helpful error message would definitely be a plus.

[Repro](http://www.typescriptlang.org/Playground/#src=module%20Foo%20%7B%0A%09var%20Bar%3A%20string%3B%0A%09%0A%7D%0A%0Aclass%20Foo2%20%7B%0A%09private%20Bar2%3A%20number%3B%0A%7D%0A%0Avar%20a%20%3D%20Foo.Bar%3B%0Avar%20b%20%3D%20(new%20Foo2()).Bar2%3B)
WorkItem.Summary: Better error message for unexported members / accessing private members
